intro: Yinshania zayuensis var. gobica, commonly known as the Gobi yinshania, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered leaves and pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
